metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15903 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser into changing from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive call to XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resulted in a heap-based buffer over-read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm2
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm2
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libvtk-java - 5.8.0-14.1ubuntu3+esm1
libvtk5.8 - 5.8.0-14.1ubuntu3+esm1
libvtk5.8-qt4 - 5.8.0-14.1ubuntu3+esm1
python-vtk - 5.8.0-14.1ubuntu3+esm1
tcl-vtk - 5.8.0-14.1ubuntu3+esm1
vtk-examples - 5.8.0-14.1ubuntu3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
coin3 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm2').
libxmltok: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
vnc4 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
vtk package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-14.1ubuntu3+esm1').
xmlrpc-c package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
